meanings.definition: In a way that represents speech sounds
meanings.sent1: She spelled her name phonetically for the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The student pronounced the word phonetically during the language lesson.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to mimic the sounds phonetically, amusing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled phonetically through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The toddler repeated the word phonetically, trying to get it just right.

meanings.definition: Using a system of symbols to represent speech sounds
meanings.sent1: The linguist studied phonetics to understand different writing systems.
meanings.sent2: The phonetics of the language helped the translator decipher the ancient text.
meanings.sent3: The secret code was based on phonetics, making it difficult for others to decode.
meanings.sent4: The musician used phonetics to create a unique musical notation system.
meanings.sent5: The book explained the importance of phonetics in language development.

meanings.definition: Relating to the sounds of speech
meanings.sent1: The phonetic alphabet helped the students learn the sounds of letters.
meanings.sent2: The phonetic spelling of the word made it easier to pronounce.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's phonetic jokes had the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The phonetic quality of her voice was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The phonetic similarities between the two languages made translation easier.
